web.title: Excuse App
web.lead: Excuse generator: criteria, tone variations, illustrated 2D UI.
web.description: A playful mobile app where the user builds an excuse through criteria (target, style, intensity), with an art direction inspired by urban signs and game UI.
web.overview: Experience-driven project: a simple flow (choose criteria → generate → iterate) with an illustrated and animated 2D interface. I designed the full art direction (backgrounds, illustrations, micro-animations) and structured the app to keep navigation smooth, logic readable, and the base easy to expand (new criteria, new tones, new categories).
role: Generation logic: criteria, variants, tone intensity

web.title: SideGeek
web.lead: Info platform + student database: Vue.js & Laravel, team work.
web.description: Collaborative project (Vue.js + Laravel): building a training platform and a database connected to student/learner profiles.
web.overview: Team project aimed at delivering a structured, maintainable and consistent app across front/back. I contributed to integration, component framing, and work organization via Git/GitHub (branches, PRs, reviews). The focus was both delivery and a healthy base: conventions, clear structure and team communication.
role: Contribution to logic and data (depending on scope)

web.title: Pasta Timer
web.lead: Cooking app: timers, pasta types, recipes, fun alarm.
web.description: A pasta-focused mobile app: choose the type, timing, recipes, and alarms — with hand-made illustrated art direction.
web.overview: The project blends usefulness and personality: a simple experience (choose → timer → alert) enriched with content (pasta types, recipes, tips) and an illustrated visual identity. I built a clear structure (JSON data, components, navigation) so the app stays stable and easy to extend (new types, new recipes, new variations).

web.title: McDo
web.lead: E-commerce demo: cart, ordering and delivery with responsive UI.
web.description: Purchase/delivery website with product → cart → confirmation flow, designed to be clear and maintainable.
web.overview: Front-end project with solid state logic: navigation, catalog, cart, recap and responsive UX. I worked on component structure, UI consistency and the readability of the purchase flow. Goal: a simple but clean app, predictable behavior and a scalable base. I also handled art direction and assets (visuals, composition, graphic consistency).
role: Art direction + asset creation (visuals) + perceived performance

web.title: Why Not
web.lead: UI concept: community & organization platform, dark/light.
web.description: Figma mockup of a community platform focused on organization, with dark & light versions and a product-minded user flow.
web.overview: Design-centered project: information hierarchy, user journey, reusable UI components and navigation logic. The goal was to build a solid base before development: consistent screens, a style system, and clean dark/light variations. I worked on the design system (typography, spacing, components) to ease future front-end integration.

web.title: Sneakers
web.lead: Shoe e-commerce: React + DB, street/cosmic universe.
web.description: Shoe e-commerce website with cart and responsive design, supported by full art direction (illustrations, animations, light/dark moods).
web.overview: Full front-end project with e-commerce logic: listing, product details, cart, and a smooth experience across screen sizes. The key point: strong art direction with two identities (colorful street in light mode, cosmic in dark mode), plus illustrated and animated assets. I kept a clean structure (components, data, styles) to avoid surprises and make the project easy to maintain.
role: Art direction: illustrations, animations, light/dark identity

web.title: NISA
web.lead: Neuroscience institute: Figma mockup, dark/light, clean structure.
web.description: Figma mockup for a neuroscience institute: editorial hierarchy, sections, and dark & light variations.
web.overview: Content and readability project: a structure designed to present an institute (missions, research, news, contact) without overload. I worked on typographic hierarchy, grids, and reusable components to achieve a serious yet modern result. The dual theme (dark/light) was designed from the start to remain coherent (contrast, accents, states).

threeD.title: Tarmac
threeD.lead: Blender modeling + animation: assets, shading, final video.
threeD.description: Complete 3D project: modeling, shading, animation and video editing, with dedicated asset creation.
threeD.overview: Production-driven project: build a coherent result from A to Z (modeling, materials, lighting, animation), then deliver a clean video (rhythm, cuts, export). I worked on perceived quality through shading/lights and motion readability, while keeping a clear pipeline (scenes, assets, exports) to iterate without breaking things.

threeD.title: Brainy
threeD.lead: Cartoon character: sculpt, shapes, render — social content (TikTok).
threeD.description: Creating a cartoon character: sculpt, proportions, details, and rendering, designed for social content (TikTok).
threeD.overview: Character-focused project: explore a readable cartoon style (silhouette, expressions, shapes) and achieve a clean, coherent render. I worked on sculpting, details and presentation for a social format: angles that read fast, simple but effective lighting, and an output ready to publish.

all.title: Brainy
all.lead: Cartoon character: sculpt, shapes, render — social content (TikTok).
all.description: A cartoon character project: sculpting, proportions, details, and rendering, designed for social content (TikTok).
all.overview: Character-focused project: explore a readable cartoon style (silhouette, expressions, shapes) and deliver a clean, consistent render. I worked on sculpting, details, and presentation for social formats: angles that read fast, simple but effective lighting, and an output ready to publish.
